ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Delusions, hallucinations or other psychotic symptoms in the absence of prominent mood symptoms during the active phases of the illness:
Notes: 0=Have never been present; 1=Have been relatively brief (less than 25%) compared to the duration of the illness ; 2=Have been present for a substantial portion (25%75%) of the illness ; 3=Have been present for most (>75%) of the illness ; 4=Have been present for most (>75%) of the illness in addition to prominent negative symptoms and/or functional decline; -999= Don't Know Missing Data

ElementDescription: Symptoms meeting criteria for a manic mood episode are present
Notes: 0=For most (>75%) of the active and residual phases of the illness ; 1=Have been present for a substantial portion (2575%) of the active and residual phases of illness ; 2=Have been relatively brief (less than 25% of the active and residual phases) of the illness ; 3=Have never been present; -999 Don't Know/Missing Data

ElementDescription: Type of mood symptoms, when present
Notes: 0=Regular/ repeated mania  1=Predominantly depression  2=No mood symptoms -999= Don't Know /Missing Data

ElementDescription: Total Score (Schizo-Bipolar Scale Sum of Questions szbp_001, szbp_002, szbp_003)
